experience: You and Cameron both know Dimitri Ponomareff, Glen Chamberlain, and 35 others
Cameron can introduce you to 3 people at Arizona Department of Corrections
Cameron worked at Arizona Department of Corrections

Full-Stack Generalist, Team LeadAngular JS 1.x, Angular 2+, TypeScript, JavaScript ES2015, React Native, D3.js, Ionic, Node.js, Express, HapiJS, Socket.io, Ruby on Rails, MySQL, Postgres, Couchbase, Sequelize, ASP.NET Web API, Entity Framework, PetaPoco, Swift, WatchKit 2.0, Realm.io, Git, GitHub, Huboard, and Enterprise design patterns• Team Lead and Full-Stack polyglot developer for multiple client engagements and development teams with varying technical stacks including Angular JS 1.x, Angular 2+, React Native, .NET, Ruby on Rails, Node.js, Express, HapiJS, Ionic, Swift with WatchKit 2.0, Phoenix Framework, and more.• Expected to learn new stacks, frameworks, and languages on a consistent basis for projects.• Assigned to the Data Engineering Practice, which is responsible for digital transformation with Big Data technologies.• Remote work managed using collaboration tools: Slack, WebEx, conference line, GitHub, Huboard, and Box.• Projects include a cost negotiation tool, transportation route optimization, a real-time iOS mobile/watch app, pharmaceutical analytics, React Native and Ionic iPhone apps, line of business apps, analytical charts, and configuration tools.• Developed style guide for Angular and Node apps including common structure for JavaScript patterns for ease of development and maintenance.• Repository patterns and interfaces for Node and Angular apps• Charting with D3.js in Angular web apps and React Native environments• Developed standards for Scrum board management and card details to guarantee Definition of Done and Definition of Ready. Now being adopted Firm-wide, including the Agile Transformation practice.---Other Projects:• Ionic 2 app

Senior Consultant(Angular JS 1.3, Web API 2, Kendo UI, C# 4.5, WCF, LINQ, Entity Framework 6, TPL, TFS 2013, design patterns)• Senior developer on internal Silverlight rewrite project, Request-to-Order, a reseller tracking tool with SOA integration to SAP CRM/ECC and other subsystems.• Responsible for porting and adding new features on the full Angular/Web API stack, using controllers, factories, custom directives, and RESTful Web API services.• Introduction of Repository and Unit of Work design patterns.

Lead Developer, Scrum Master C#, MVC 4, DDD, StructureMap, AutoMapper, WCF, AppFabric, jQuery, Twitter Bootstrap, LINQ, Entity Framework 5 Code-First, Repository, Unit of Work, Dependency Injection, TPL, WPF, TFS 2012, Oracle, UML, design patterns• Lead developer on the State Birth Registration application. MVC 4 and WCF with Domain-Driven Design N-Layered Architecture.• Identified technical debt. Large refactoring effort in Brownfield environment.• Introduced industry-standard programming practices and concepts. Team mentoring and pair programming.• Dependency Injection, Inversion of Control, Adaptor/DTO using AutoMapper, composite ViewModels and other design patterns.• Implemented enterprise architecture application stack and applied patterns: enterprise caching, service oriented architecture, etc.• Source Control Manager. Implemented a customized Scrum-Ban process, TFS Application Lifecycle Management (ALM), Branching Strategy, deployment targets for automated builds, and check-in policies. Coached and trained the team and organization in proper source control management, branching strategy, and Scrum ALM process. • Introduced and developed the Domain-Driven Design, Cross-Cutting, Unit of Work, Repository, • Developed several processes, including a business rules engine. Architecture using UML.• Composable reporting framework, using LINQ expressions, generics, reflection, specification pattern.

NRG Real-Time Distributed Solar Project: Lead Developer on a bootstrapped Real-Time distributed data collection system for solar, wind, and diesel.C#, MVC 4, SignalR, Windows Service Bus, OPC UA, WCF, jQuery, Twitter Bootstrap, LINQ, Entity Framework 5 Code-First, SQL 2012, SVG, TPL, SQL CTE, Repository, Unit of Work, Dependency Injection, TFS 2012, Scrum, design patterns• Pilot project doing real-time data collection for distributed solar, stand-by generation, and wind.• Microsoft stack over Enterprise Service Bus talking to OPC on in-house built hardware modules installed in Phoenix, Minnesota, California, and Texas with datacenter deployed in Texas.• Lead developer, choosing and implementing the Microsoft and database side of the technology stack for real-time data collection, storage and transmission to live web application.• Real-Time over web using ASP.NET SignalR, displaying data in charts, grids, and SVG.• Windows Service Bus for distributed messaging of binary data storage and push to web.• Hierarchical Asset/Equipment model for configuration and data warehousing.• Sub-second data stored in binary time-series database for multiple data points.• Developed .NET wrapper for time-series data recovery and asynchronous querying.• Data warehousing using SQL CLR over web services to binary time series database.• NERC-compliant architecture.

Responsible for creating the Apex Clear Scrum process, a custom on-boarding and Scrum adoption process for consulting design-build projects, used by Apex for all global projects. Sales engineer with one of Apex preferred clients for adopting the process.

recommendations: Costantino Pipero
Partner and Technology Lead at Beeond.
February 8, 2016, Cameron worked with Costantino in the same group

Cameron and I worked directly together in the design and development of a remote data acquisition and monitoring system for a big power generation company. He was in charge of the creation of a service bus transport to get the data from OPC UA data sources to be delivered to a SignalR enable Web front-end (he found that architecture to be the best fit). The project was delivered successfully and performed as per requirements.Cameron strong feature is commitment: he strives to deliver the best solution possible. And that means that he is not boxed in a given technology, in fact he  has quite an impressive portfolio of skills.That knowledge also gives him the extra edge in offer him an higher point of view when it comes to envision the right fit for a customer requirement.Needless to say, I am always looking forward to the next opportunity to work with Cameron.

Cameron is a top notch problem solver with a keen eye for the enterprise. He has fantastic overlap of knowledge and experience from both the business and implementation side of software development. This experience allows him to zero in on exactly what the customer wants, and his superior programming ability makes him able to implement it in a scaleable and maintainable way.I am happy to work with Cameron on any problem since I know he will both make sure we are following best practices and using KISS/DRY principles, while also thinking outside the box for innovation.

summary: • 18 years of professional experience in Leadership, Change Management, Process Improvement, Software Development, Software Architecture and Design, Project Management, Business Analysis.• 8 years in a Scrum environment as a Scrum Master (CSM since 06/2012), Developer, and Coach.• Strong leadership, design, and development skills with a focus on continuous improvement. Lean Software Development, Lean Start-Up, and Scrum cultural practices. Inspect and adapt!• Line of Business application developer with strong analytical skills.• Proven ability to assess technical issues and provide effective, solid solutions.• Ability to translate the needs of the business into real solutions.• Well organized and seasoned developer with proven experience.• Practice of SOLID, DRY, and Separation of Concerns design principles. Applied Gang of Four Design Patterns. Enterprise Patterns: Repository, Unit of Work, Dependency Injection, Inversion of Control, Domain Driven Design.Specialties: Lean Start-Up, Leadership, Collaboration, Intrapreneur, Certified Scrum Master (CSM), Lead Senior Developer, TFS 2012 with ALM and Scrum 2.0, Software Architecture, DDD N-Layered Architecture, Line of Business apps, Source Control Manager, Enterprise Design Patterns, Microsoft technology stack, and more.
